meanings.definition: A set that is part of a larger set.
meanings.sent1: In the math class, we learned about a subset of numbers.
meanings.sent2: The subset of fruits included apples, oranges, and bananas.
meanings.sent3: The subset of toys in the box looked like a small treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of stamps was just a tiny subset of her grandfather's.
meanings.sent5: The subset of stars visible in the city sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To be a part of a larger set.
meanings.sent1: Each color subset contributes to the beauty of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The new data subset will be added to the existing database.
meanings.sent3: I always feel like a subset of the team when I join the game.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas subset nicely into the overall project plan.
meanings.sent5: The different melodies subset together to create a harmonious song.
